description: This shows the candidate has a formal education in a relevant field, as requested in the job description ('formal software education and/or a ton of practical experience').

Listing relevant programming languages is strong. While the job description emphasizes C#, .NET, and SQL, the listed languages demonstrate transferable skills and web development expertise that could be valuable.

The project showcases practical experience in web development using modern technologies (Next.js, Spring Boot). The candidate also details the use of optimization techniques. This demonstrates initiative and relevant skills.

text: Using Spring Boot and Spring data JPA for managing
description: Highlighting the use of Spring Boot and Spring Data JPA, combined with Spring Security, is strong. This shows the candidate has some experience with backend development and security best practices.

The awards and certificates section could be improved. While mentioning participation in programming contests is good, the description lack description of the certificates such as The 2023 ICPC Vietnam National Programming Contest. The contest details can be added to provide context of what the contest do and what is the important of this certificate.

The CV does not have any information about the candidate's experience with Agile methodologies like Scrum or Kanban. While the group project suggests potential teamwork, there's no evidence of participation in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, or retrospectives. The candidate should consider adding any agile experience to strengthen their profile.

Providing links to GitHub repositories is excellent. However, the CV lacks explicit details about testing and debugging strategies. Adding a section about testing methodologies (unit tests, integration tests, etc.) and debugging experience would significantly strengthen the application.

While listing C/C++ is helpful, it doesn't align directly with the job's focus on C#, .NET, and SQL. The candidate could improve this by either demonstrating C# and .NET skills in their projects or explaining how their C/C++ experience translates to these technologies.
